name: wickiup
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a type of temporary home traditionally made by Native Americans in the southwestern US, which has an oval wood frame covered with grass, leaves, branches, animal skins, or cloth: One of the traditional dwellings of Apaches is the wickiup, which is a dwelling that can be made almost anywhere. Compare
wigwam
Buyenlarge/Archive Photos/GettyImages
More examplesFewer examplesHe chose to build the wickiup, a traditional wood-framed structure used by American Indians for shelter and ceremonial purposes.I decided to turn the debris into a wickiup, a stick-frame shelter that looks like an upside-down bowl.We come to a tiny canvas wickiup, a dozen feet across and five feet high at the top of the dome.
